item.title: Here’s How Landlords can Benefit From the Coworking Boom
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents Infosys recently announced permanent Work From Home for 33% to 55% of its employees. On similar lines, TCS too claimed that by 2025, only 25% of its workforce will be coming its offices. As traditional workplaces decentralise, and WFH fatigue kicks in, coworking spaces will be in their best position to showcase …

Here’s How Landlords can Benefit From the Coworking Boom Read More »

The post Here’s How Landlords can Benefit From the Coworking Boom appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

Infosys recently announced permanent Work From Home for 33% to 55% of its employees. On similar lines, TCS too claimed that by 2025, only 25% of its workforce will be coming its offices. As traditional workplaces decentralise, and WFH fatigue kicks in, coworking spaces will be in their best position to showcase themselves as ad-hoc solutions.

Aren’t we convinced already that work from home cannot be a permanent set-up for India? Coworking units will now act as ad-hoc spaces while enterprises try to figure out the new normal.

What will businesses look out for in a coworking space post COVID-19?

    • The Need for an Office

Take the example of Chennai-based Karya Spaces for example. Karya Spaces opened a new centre in Nungambakkam in January. Instead of making the most of the booming commercial real estate industry, witnessed a massive downfall as client base dropped by 30% in March.

However, since the lockdown restrictions have been eased in May, nearly 100 enquiries to rent desks are flooding in. For any company to develop and thrive, real-life interaction of the workforce is essential. And that’s where the importance of offices, or rather coworking spaces kicks in.

    • The Need for a Community

We did some research and most employees when given a choice between an office and a coworking space, would choose the latter. Unlike traditional offices, a coworking space encourages people to interact with those from similar and different businesses.

It’s like an informal collaboration of sorts because you can exchange fresh ideas, perspectives, and contacts.

    • The Need for Safe Spaces

Before the pandemic, coworking spaces that offered 450 seats are cutting it down to say 240 seats to maintain social distancing. They are also providing safety equipments, setting new hygiene protocols, handsfree entries, etc.

To attract businesses and ensure the safety of the workforce, coworking spaces are moving from a rental model to a hospitality set-up. In addition to infrastructure and safety measures, they are also providing new services, software, etc.

Landlords and property owners that meet and exceed these new expectations can greatly benefit from the coworking boom that’s already upon us. As JLL predicts, corporate demand will grow significantly after the pandemic, as many major companies like Starbucks, Microsoft, and Facebook are already on the lookout for coworking spaces.

The post Here’s How Landlords can Benefit From the Coworking Boom appeared first on Propques.

item.title: 7 Things Landlords Need To Do Before Starting a Coworking Space
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents According to Statista, the number of people using a coworking space has increased from just 21 thousand in 2010 to 3 million users in the year 2020. That is a whopping 14,185.71% increase in the number of people using a coworking space. These numbers might give you a brief idea as to …

7 Things Landlords Need To Do Before Starting a Coworking Space Read More »

The post 7 Things Landlords Need To Do Before Starting a Coworking Space appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

According to Statista, the number of people using a coworking space has increased from just 21 thousand in 2010 to 3 million users in the year 2020. That is a whopping 14,185.71% increase in the number of people using a coworking space. These numbers might give you a brief idea as to why so many landlords are planning to convert their properties into a fully flexible co-working space. If you are one of them, then you have come to the right place. 

In this blog, we are going to list out 7 things landlords need to do before starting a coworking space.

Do your Research

Knowledge is power, which is why the first thing you must do is before starting your coworking space is to do very thorough research. 

Here are a few questions to ask yourself:

 

    • What is the scope of coworking space in my area/locality?

    • Who are my competitors?

    • How are they providing their services?

    • How can I make my service better than my competitors?

    • Should I partner with an operator?

Decide on Your Framework

There are different models or frameworks of coworking space that you can choose between, and you can choose the one that fits with your particular circumstances.

 

  • Coworking space within your business.

If you have a business with unused space, then you could convert your space into a fully flexible coworking space. That way, you can benefit from the profits of both the businesses and have access to cultivating a professional relationship with talented individuals.

 

  • Coworking with events and education programme.

If you are a landlord with skills that you think other people can benefit from, then you could host programs in your coworking space. You could also partner with other content providers. You could charge for the events or find people who could sponsor them. 

 

  • Coworking + office space

If you have a large space, then you could reserve a third of it for private offices. That way, you can have clients from both ends of the spectrum. 

Create a financial model for your Coworking Space

When beginning a coworking business, you should create a financial model. This will allow you to gauge whether you have sufficient funds to start the business and the amount of profit or loss to expect from running the business. To create your financial model, take a look at the various revenue streams and the costs associated with it.

Start building your community 

One of the biggest mistakes you can make is assuming people will come to your space as soon as you open it. You need to start building your community and make a name for yourself long before you start your coworking space.

Design for your community, not for yourself

While designing a coworking layout, you must choose a design that appeals to your community rather than a design that fits the maximum number of people per square feet.

Plan to make it more economically viable

Do you plan to make big bucks from your coworking space? Plan to make your space more economically viable. To attract more clients, you could integrate as many services as possible in your coworking space so that users can spend more money inside than outside of it. For example, you could install a gym, a cafeteria or a sauna. You could offer services like spa, yoga or host events.. 

There are endless examples of making your coworking space more economically viable, limited only by your imagination and budget.

Hire a good Team

Lastly, if you want to run a successful coworking business, then you must do it with a great team. You need to make sure you hire people who understand this business as well as you do. You need to make sure they have all the necessary skills required and that they have a personality which matches with the community that you plan to create.

The steps you take are very crucial because they will decide the success or failure of your business. If you need any assistance in starting your coworking business, then, do consider reaching out to our team because here at Propques, we have a panel of experienced professions who can help simplify the process of starting your business and turn your business profitable.

The post 7 Things Landlords Need To Do Before Starting a Coworking Space appeared first on Propques.

item.title: How to Expand your Coworking Business
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents Extensive Planning, Hard work and perseverance are key ingredients to expanding any business and expanding a coworking business is no different. In this blog, we are going to list out some of the key points that you must consider before expanding your Coworking business. Analyse your present business Before you even think …

How to Expand your Coworking Business Read More »

The post How to Expand your Coworking Business appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

Extensive Planning, Hard work and perseverance are key ingredients to expanding any business and expanding a coworking business is no different.

In this blog, we are going to list out some of the key points that you must consider before expanding your Coworking business.

Analyse your present business

Before you even think about expanding your coworking business, you must first put all your effort in analysing your present business. Here are a few questions that you need to ask yourself before you plan to expand your present business:

 

    • Is my present business stable?

    • Does my Coworking business generate enough cash flow or revenue to support my present business as well as provide for the expansion?

    • Do I need to hire new people?

    • Is this the right time to expand?

After you have analysed your business, now it’s time to do some market research.

Choose The Correct Location

Choosing the right location to expand your business is the next most important step of your expansion process. Do not choose a location just because it is cheap.  Ensure that there is scope for further growth and expansion in the location of your choice. Our advice would be to hire a local firm that will guide you through this process. In fact, Propques can help you with this process through its vast network of landlords in different cities across India.   

Do Your Market Research

You must research the market that you are planning to expand your Coworking business in. When you conduct successful market research, you will learn the following.

 

    • Potential costumers

    • How large is your target market?

    • How often do your costumers use your service?

    • Competition in the market

    • What strategies are your competitors using?

Create a business plan

In the business world change is inevitable. Your existing business model might be working absolutely fine in your current location but it may fail once you expand. Therefore, you must adapt to the changes in the market and create a business plan that considers all these changes. Don’t just stick to a single plan. Stimulate all the possible scenarios in your mind and make plans for each scenario. That way, you will always have a backup plan if anything goes wrong.

Be Strategic

Now that you have done your market research and created plans, it is time to devise different strategies which you can use to start your expansion. Your strategies will become the deciding factor for the impact you will make among your competitors once you expand.

Consider your personnel

As you start your expansion you will need a strong team of managers and HR professionals to manage the transition as you begin to grow. You will also need to consider how many employees you need depending on the size of your expansion. Hiring new staff and bringing a host of new faces can be unsettling for your current employees,  so you need to be sure that the recruitment strategies are being used effectively and that employees with the right set of skills are hired.

The Bottom Line

Expanding your coworking business will not seem such a complex task If done with the right amount of team-work and coordination. As James Cash Penney once said, “Growth is never by mere chance; it is the result of forces working together.” It is just a matter of doing the right thing at the right time.

The post How to Expand your Coworking Business appeared first on Propques.

item.title: Most Common Demographics of Coworking Space Users
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents As per the Global Coworking Growth study, there are currently over 19,000+ coworking spaces worldwide and this number is expected to cross over 40,000 by the year 2024. As the coworking spacescontinue to expand, who are the people that leverage the coworking spaces totheir benefit? Well, in this blog we are going …

Most Common Demographics of Coworking Space Users Read More »

The post Most Common Demographics of Coworking Space Users appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

As per the Global Coworking Growth study, there are currently over 19,000+ coworking spaces worldwide and this number is expected to cross over 40,000 by the year 2024.

As the coworking spaces
continue to expand, who are the people that leverage the coworking spaces to
their benefit? Well, in this blog we are going to answer the exact same
question.

To make things simpler, we
are going to divide the demographics of coworking space users into four
distinct sections, namely: Region, Age, Gender and Sector,

Region

From 19,000+ coworking
spaces across the world, nearly 11,000 are from the Asia-Pacific region, making
it the world largest coworking region. Which is followed by 5000+ in North
America and South America, while there are around 3.000+ coworking spaces in
Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.

Here are some quick facts:

 

    • India
      being the fastest-growing coworking market with over 13 million people
      estimated to operate out of coworking spaces by the end of 2024.

    • Another study
      reveals the fastest-growing coworking cities across the world:

New Dehli
leading the race with a growth rate of 46%, followed by Toronto at 35% and
Berlin and Chicago at 31%.

Age

The stereotype for a
coworking space is that it is a place where young people go to work and have
fun. Well, the fun part is true but the young people part is not entirely true.
The median age of male coworkers across the world is around 35 years, up from
33.5 years in 2012. Whereas, most females in a coworking space are in the age
group of 25-35. Most people sharing a Coworking space are between the age of
between 30-39 years. Though there are a small number of coworkers above age 50.
However, the average age is increasing slightly every year.

Sector

Coworking spaces have grown exponentially since their creation in the year 2005 and so has its diversification. Coworking space users come from a broad spectrum of professions. Freelancers, entrepreneurs, hackers, socialists, IT professionals and bankers are all members of the coworking community, even large enterprises have now started using coworking space to leverage the advantages of flexible space-as-a-service and office decentralization. In fact, in one recent study of companies larger than 100 employees, one in seven respondents claimed to be a member of the coworking community.

According to a recent study by Coworker:

 

    • Small-to-medium
      sized enterprises(SMEs) comprise about 37.93%

    • Followed
      by Startups, with  27.12% of coworking
      members.

    • 16.61% of
      coworking users are freelancers

    • 7.68% are
      entrepreneurs

    • 5.49% are
      remote workers

    • 2.82% are
      digital nomads and,

    • 2.35% are
      large-scale-corporations

Gender

The coworking spaces are
somewhat equally distributed among men and women. The average percentage of
women in coworking is between 40-45%. Whereas, the percentage of males working
from a coworking space is about 50-55%.

 

    • According to most surveys, there is an increase in the number of female coworkers since the past few years.

    • Another study reveals that the percentage of married female members in a coworking space drops, especially in the age group between 30-50. The main reason for this appears to be childcare.

    • Most coworking individuals are well educated. Around 85% of them have completed an academic education.

Bottom Line

To wrap it up, the most
common demographics of coworking space users are members of SMEs and startup
teams with an average age of between 30-35 years.

The post Most Common Demographics of Coworking Space Users appeared first on Propques.

item.title: The Coworking Onboarding Process: A Crucial Aspect for Retaining Members
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
New members joining the flexible spaces, while some are new to it, some are not, and what welcomes them first is the co-working onboarding process. And with the situation around, this process holds even more importance now. When competition is on a high and seeing the growing market, every flexible space operator is trying something different. …

The Coworking Onboarding Process: A Crucial Aspect for Retaining Members Read More »

The post The Coworking Onboarding Process: A Crucial Aspect for Retaining Members appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
New members joining the flexible spaces, while some are new to it, some are not, and what welcomes them first is the co-working onboarding process. And with the situation around, this process holds even more importance now. When competition is on a high and seeing the growing market, every flexible space operator is trying something different.

Why is the coworking onboarding process crucial?

Technically, the coworking onboarding process is the face of a flexible space, which greets and comforts the fresh members flocking. However, not to undermine, this process is also crucial when we talk about retaining members in a flexible space. Multiple unsuccessful and negatively rated coworking have a mismanaged and disorderly onboarding procedure.

This process needs documentation so that a proper routine and pattern are present. Also, it helps in tracking errors and suggesting changes. One of the most important benefits of this process, it helps in retaining the members, as it is quite a widely known fact that it is easier to keep good members than attracting new ones.

Elements to consider in a coworking onboarding process! 

Now, when we know the vitality of this process, we must figure out the ingredients that cook up a promising onboarding strategy. These elements are a must for a new or to improve an existing process. One can notice the difference in productivity after including these methods, as they closely relate to uplifting member satisfaction for space

1.Cheer the new members for their joining decision

New members are often surrounded with confusion, whether they made the right decision about joining a flexible space or not. A simple method is to drop a welcome email that pats their back and motivates them for future success.

However, making welcome videos will hurt your community manager’s schedule with extra responsibility. But, one can use apps like Loom for creating an effective one. But, what to mention in these videos is also a crucial thing.

  • Start with congratulating them for their decision to join.
  • Educate them on the onboarding process features, how it will benefit and how it relates, etc.
  • Scan them, figure out what they have in their mind, and promote that aspect of your space that will entertain and comfort them the most.
  • Welcome with suggestions like which existing member they should connect to, as you feel that person matches their vibe. It will make them feel that they are vital for space. And will instil a feeling that they are at the right place.
  • Also, you can guide them to an in-person onboarding meeting for more details.

2. Coworking onboarding process to introduce them to space

This element is vital, as a new member doesn’t know your space and will struggle to find and use the facilities. It will make him uncomfortable and will lessen his desire to continue with the place.

For resolving this struggle and discomfort, it is crucial to introduce them to space. A proper introduction will help to recognize and value the facilities available. Also, this will instil a sense of pleasure and comfort in them and help them move around with ease. And consequently will build a supportive experience for space and will positively affect their decision to stay.

3. Introduce them to space culture and community norms

Members joining will either be someone who switched to this space from another one or can be the one who is new to this concept. If a member is naive to the coworking concept, he will be unknown to its culture and etiquettes. While, if the member has already used a service, will be familiar with etiquettes but might bring some bad or upsetting habits from the past.

To resolve this issue, it is a must to don the ‘Den Mom’ hat and clarify the rules to the new members like leaving dishes and items anywhere is not allowed, don’t leave writing on the whiteboards, etc. Members will not feel offended if you strictly clarify the rules and culture to them, obviously with a hint of humour.

4. The coworking onboarding process should focus on a positive experience in the Last week

A positive experience in the first 7-days at a space gets the members motivated and feel promising about the place, says research studies. Joining is not a big deal for some people but, for some, it is an investment. And, you have to convince and assure them that they have invested in the right place.

Everyone has got their reasons for joining, and for that, it is crucial to sit down with them in person and understand their needs and expectations. For a brief idea, we can pen down some general member profiles for reference.

Member profile 1: One can encounter some new members who have switched to theirs after the last one got closed or something. These members are known to the concept, and introducing them to facilities and effectiveness of flexible space is not a big task.

But, these members can carry some relaxed approach and bad habits from the past one. It will be a troublesome situation for the current one, as their routine may not fit in or disrupt the environment. It is best to talk to them to understand their expectations, including them in onboarding meetings. But, do not force them for meetings or lunch, let them feel comfortable, show hospitality towards them by providing supplies.

Member profile2: Some members from the corporate background will opt for a space to escape the distractions of working at home. They will not be aware of the etiquettes, as the atmosphere here is quite different from home.

Member Profile 3: These members are the toughest ones to persuade, as they are the ones who opted for a space for some networking interest or to build some referrals. These people are more concerned about the ROI factor of the membership fees.

It is tough to motivate them but can be possible through personal interaction. And by heightening the interest by introducing to other members.

Bottom Line

The coworking onboarding process is crucial, especially when you have competition in your area. So, having an effective one to know your members better in the first week is a must for successful member retention.

The post The Coworking Onboarding Process: A Crucial Aspect for Retaining Members appeared first on Propques.

item.title: Pre-sell coworking space: more than a marketing plan, it’s a mindset.
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents Who would not love to have some members enrolled in their coworking space even before the launch? Pre-sell coworking space if you want to experience this phenomenon for your property also. But, more than a marketing tactic, pre-selling is an approach. An approach that lets you have a vision, believe it and cultivate the …

Pre-sell coworking space: more than a marketing plan, it’s a mindset. Read More »

The post Pre-sell coworking space: more than a marketing plan, it’s a mindset. appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

Who would not love to have some members enrolled in their coworking space even before the launch? Pre-sell coworking space if you want to experience this phenomenon for your property also. But, more than a marketing tactic, pre-selling is an approach. An approach that lets you have a vision, believe it and cultivate the support of others on the journey to success.

Plan to pre-sell coworking space, your mindset matters!

Preparing your marketing plans extensively for your coworking is essential to achieve promising sales returns but, your efforts may go to waste if your mindset is not correct. It is crucial to have the right approach for the flexible space, diversification of marketing tools, and member enrolment. 

It is essential to have the right approach to pre-sell coworking space. Right attitude helps to realize the value of your coworking and helps to have a clear frame of mind. Your mindset makes the difference as it is the deciding factor behind the effectiveness of your marketing strategy. It will be hard for you to identify your targets if your approach is not in the right direction. You will be confused between the actual methods to apply for making an impact on the potential customers.

Mindset is the reason why some coworking operators excel, while some perish despite having similar opportunities. Formulating your marketing policies in advance is beneficial if you plan to pre-sell coworking space. And with the right attitude, you can achieve that target feasibly. 

Become a visionary to pre-sell coworking space

We talk about gathering knowledge and understanding about the coworking space when we ask someone to become a visionary. When one realizes the value and vision of the coworking space, only then motivating others to become part of it is possible. That brings us to a category of successful species of coworking operators, the visionaries or the action-takers. 

Visionaries keep no stone unturned and campaign for their space through word of mouth and other mediums. They believe that their coworking space holds a distinct value in the industry. And, they are providing a fully-serviced work platform to the community, which will help small businesses scale up. They constantly look into available options through research to add more amenities to their workspace.

As visionaries are clear about the effectiveness of marketing efforts, they can pre-sell coworking space. They can attract some people to their concept, which will help them to have more people when coworking opens up. With more sales, they are supposed to have faster returns on investment. 

Reading the lines above, one will be more than ready to become a visionary. One must vigorously perform some activities that will be missing in the inactive lot.

 

    • Formulating online and offline marketing strategy in detail; evaluating mediums for maximum effectiveness.

    • Spreading news about the coming space among the members of a local business group or association.

    • Have a strategic discussion with local associations to host their events, to reach out to potential members.

    • Organizing tours and off-site presentations for potential customers to pre-sell coworking space.

    • Procuring local signboards at a probable meeting place for business holders like coffee shops.

    • Scheduling kiosks at local events for awareness and exposure.

    • Follow-up of interested members.

 

    • Using social media panels for updates about construction progress. 

    • Co-coordinating with bloggers, social media influencers to promote workspace, build a long-term relationship with them.

    • Use Google Adwords and other paid promotion mediums. 

    • Professional photoshoot of the space focused on highlighting the positive features of the place. 

    • Organizing a grand opening party in the presence of local dignitaries and popular names in the area. 

Apart from that, there are some other things an action-taker needs to do, like providing discounts to early members or negotiating with clients for free membership for some time. Having some early members at the place motivates the potential customers doing the tour. One can also have those early members at the time of the photoshoot to attract eyeballs.

Visionaries have a marketing budget and timeline in place; that helps them to execute plans and to pre-sell coworking space. They are social media friendly and use digital marketing techniques to the best. They ask their family, friends, colleagues to review their space for good reviews; to attract customers. They are always busy posting photos, building organic SEO, and putting member logos on the website, for sharing space growth.

Visionaries are pretty much clear that no space could be perfect. A perfect coworking at the time of opening is not possible. But, for sure, one can create a better space slowly and steadily, with the support of early members and staff. And, this is why they consider marketing and awareness essential for the business.

Want to pre-sell coworking space; never be the opposite of visionary!

When not being a visionary, a person falls on the other side, the deferrers, the person who believes that people buy those things only that are visible to their eyes. It makes them go for a full-furnished space with an open sign before reaching others for sale and membership.

With no pre-selling in mind, marketing campaigns get planned accordingly, which snatches the pre-selling opportunity. It reduces involvement with local businesses and potential members, which leads to low or nil pre-selling. However, the need is to increase the engagement and effectiveness of marketing plans; expert services of Propques can be handy in that. One can connect to a qualified team at Propques to redefine their business approach. 

Deferrers have the energy and the potential to pre-sell coworking space and to bring in new members. But, as they do not find the raw space worthy enough to attract potential members, they postpone their marketing plans. It is why these types of sellers are not considered fruitful for the coworking business. Their approach is not favourable to the marketing and networking plans and may hurt in the long run.

Realize the difference!

Bottom Line

Being a visionary is better for your coworking and yourself, for you build so many contacts. And, even if you were a deferrer all the time, switch to another one now for better results. The new approach will help in pre-selling and also in future activities.

The post Pre-sell coworking space: more than a marketing plan, it’s a mindset. appeared first on Propques.

item.title: Co-working Consultants: How do they make a difference?
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents Coworking spaces are on a boom, workplaces are getting redefined. Every commercial property owner is looking to cash this situation. With rising competition in this sector, the need of having experienced guidance for setting up & finding a workspace has become a must; this is where coworking consultants come into play. How coworking consultants …

Co-working Consultants: How do they make a difference? Read More »

The post Co-working Consultants: How do they make a difference? appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

Coworking spaces are on a boom, workplaces are getting redefined. Every commercial property owner is looking to cash this situation. With rising competition in this sector, the need of having experienced guidance for setting up & finding a workspace has become a must; this is where coworking consultants come into play.

How coworking consultants support?

Whether a person owns a commercial property, is searching for a workspace, or runs one, it is pretty viable that he needs guidance. Guidance will depend on the client they are confronting, a property owner, a corporate or freelancer, or a coworking operator.

As this industry is quite vast, and just like other businesses, it also has different departments. Coworking consultants help in analyzing these departments per individual perspective, as they have expertise in this industry. They make it easier for a newcomer to understand the intricacies of it. However, some people undermine their importance and neglect their suggestions, which hurt their aspirations and projections later.

Why coworking operators need the support of coworking consultants?

Successfully running a flexible space is a cumbersome task, especially when this industry sees the entry of new players regularly. Competition has increased, but with better guidance, one can glide around through it.

Coworking operators have so many aspects to watch in their business that they may miss out on some important ones. But, if one has experienced and dependable support from coworking consultants, the journey through the road to success becomes smooth.

Better industry insights

It is always good to have a deep knowledge of your operational sector. Coworking consultants help operators to get familiar with working patterns and trends of the industry. As they are more knowledgeable about the past, present, and future of the coworking sector, they have better suggestions. Also, they are aware of developments going around in other areas in the same industry, which also helps.

Space utilization & expansion

Equipped with stunning architecture & interior design experts, coworking consultants can make your space look bigger and fuller. The changes suggested by them may help you accommodate more staff & items comfortably at your workplace. Not only this increases work efficiency but, adds to the cost-benefit factor also.

An enhanced set of products/services

Consultants know end-consumers better, as they have seen types of them, it helps in formulating products/services, which are more effective. And, also do they contribute to the optimization of the business model by incorporating multiple beneficial processes.

Strengthening office operations

Hiring coworking consultants for your space can boost the effectiveness of your office ecosystem. They suggest better ways to manage office operations. And advise activities and methods to amplify employee collaboration. Apart from that, there are multiple things they support a coworking operator that finally end up in escalating profits of the company.

How coworking consultants benefit property owners?

For instance, if a property owner with space wills to commit it for a coworking. But, to join the ongoing trend of converting a vacant property into a decent coworking space, he will have to learn the basics of this industry.

But do you think it is possible for a landlord or a real estate player? Is it possible for him to subside his skills of property dealing and indulge in a new horizon of coworking space development? You will say no.

It is why; enrolling coworking consultants to develop some well-fabricated workspace seems feasible, as they have expertise in every aspect related to coworking.

Revitalizing under-used property

One can use a property for multiple purposes but, sticking to the most promising option is best for garnering profits. Coworking consultants analyze your property aspects like location, exclusiveness, etc., and suggest a better model accordingly.

User-focused space design

Developing a property and developing it according to user criteria are two different things. Designing a space full of amenities that suits the user needs is a must, to attract some willing customers in the future.

Connecting directly to the final user

Having a direct connection to the final user always benefits. Coworking consultants help you connect to your end-users to crack a better deal and mould your services according to user liking.

Uplifting ROI

Easing up a process for users invokes customer’s interest in one’s services. Leasing contracts with more flexibility are more favourable to startups & others. However, a consultant helps you evaluate and finalize a suitable one, where both ends have a win-win situation. Also, it improves ROI in the longer run

Adding value

Gathering data throughout the process and segregating it for future use is essential if one targets an increment in portfolio value. For analyzing previous data & facts helps in figuring out a better strategy.

Some other benefits of coworking consultants are also there, which help the property owners, manage their assets better.

Corporate or freelancers, coworking consultants assist is guaranteed!

Searching and reaching out for an appropriate flexible space for your work is a thoughtful task. It needs a good understanding of coworking places and their features. Without this, you may end up with a workplace that adversely affects your operations.

Coworking consultants help you in this regard; they employ all knowledge and expertise to find a feasible space for their clients. They have got links to existing and upcoming hybrid places. And also have an insight into the changing trends of the market. Here is how they benefit:

Collaborative & innovative workplace

A good consultant will prefer an innovative & productive work atmosphere for their clients. A comfortable space heightens the work potential and creativity factor. And, also escalates collaborative instinct among the team.

Improved work efficiency

A suitable workspace with facilities for work fluency is a crucial tool to increase work productivity. One may find it hard to choose the appropriate well-equipped workspace for employees. Coworking consultants have the knowledge and skills to understand the needs and to select a desirable space accordingly.

Better employee management

In a new flexible office, strategies for employee management also get redefined. Consultants are experts in strategy building; they suggest various techniques & tactics to employers for employee management. They have a long list of proven methods to motivate the employees of an office. And, also know ways to increase the sense of belonging in them towards the workplace & company.

Good office culture for better talent

Coworking consultants have a store full of advice for improving the work culture of an office. They suggest activities and methods that enhance the work atmosphere and build a workable system. A rich work culture heightens the work values of an office, helping the talent at the place to get glued to it. Moreover, it also attracts more talent, as the good vibes of your workspace spread around.

Bottomline

Coworking consultants benefit the work atmosphere and profit-loss statement of space, no doubt about that. But, choosing an inexperienced & adept one also has its demerits. So, one must be careful while selecting one for his space. For a better insight into coworking space, you can hang on to our other blogs.

The post Co-working Consultants: How do they make a difference? appeared first on Propques.

item.title: How to add/start Coworking Space at your owned property
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Commercial real estate owners have been intrigued by coworking for the last few years, but always a little uneasy about breaking with the tradition of long-term leases. As times have changed in 2022, commercial real estate owners know they need to offer more flexible terms and need to experiment with the coworking model or risk …

How to add/start Coworking Space at your owned property Read More »

The post How to add/start Coworking Space at your owned property appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Commercial real estate owners have been intrigued by coworking for the last few years, but always a little uneasy about breaking with the tradition of long-term leases. As times have changed in 2022, commercial real estate owners know they need to offer more flexible terms and need to experiment with the coworking model or risk years of lost revenue with high vacancies. Propques Expert Team helps property owners to understand five different ways they can add coworking to their property with a monthly break down of costs for each model.

Property owners have a lot of flexibility in how they add coworking into their spaces. Each coworking model has a varying degree of risk, profit, and required effort ranging from handling daily operations to just cashing in monthly checks. The free property planning Report outlines the pluses and minuses of each model for coworking management contracts, joint ventures, franchising, traditional leases, and starting your own coworking brand.

Here are the five coworking models that Propques evaluates for your commercial real estate property.

Management Contract

Coworking management contracts are revenue share partnerships that allow property owners to profit from coworking spaces’ rapid growth while partnering with experienced coworking operators. In a typical contract, the property owner is responsible for 90-100% of the full buildout cost, and in exchange, the owner receives the full lease rate plus a large share of the coworking profits. 

Coworking management contracts work well for existing coworking chains because it allows them to rapidly expand to new locations and specialize on being great operators and service providers. The partnership of management contracts allow the property owner and coworking operator to leverage their strengths and assets in order to quickly grow and stand out from competitors. 

Experienced operators are still rare in the market, and typically only well-placed properties with a high buildout budget are considered. This is expected to change in upcoming years as both owners and operators gain confidence in the model.

Joint Venture Revenue share & Profit Share

Joint ventures are common in the business world and work well for coworking businesses. Coworking partnerships work best when each partner brings something unique to the table: the property, the expertise, and sometimes the funding. 

Joint ventures typically draw upon local investors and operators. It‘s often easier to find partners willing to invest in a local business than it is to negotiate a management contract from a larger national firm, particularly for smaller cities and lower-class properties. The operating partners are often smaller chains or new entrepreneurs – this can bring an element of risk, but this is balanced out by more input from the investors. Additionally, it‘s easier to bring on financial investors to join the property owner and operator to assist in buildout costs when traditional lending sources aren‘t readily available. 

Overall, joint ventures are a good choice for investors that can bring business acumen to the table, while leaving the day-to-day operations, control, and a share of the profit to other partners.

Franchise

For owners that want to operate their business with significant operations help, operating a franchise might be the right solution. 

Franchises provide enterprise-level support that even experienced coworking operators can‘t easily match. Franchises invest in unparalleled marketing & branding campaigns to funnel clients to your door, and often provide turnkey training manuals and software packages to help keep operations smooth. Different franchises target different markets and property types, which makes finding the right partner significantly easier. 

Franchises typically reach profitability faster, and you benefit from a loyal network (resulting in lower vacancies and more profitability from conference rooms and event rentals.) Franchises typically take a cut of revenue, not profit, which can be a hard burden to overcome. Your risk is about the same as starting from scratch, although exiting the business with an active contract is more difficult. 

Traditional Lease

Leasing to a coworking space is a familiar and comfortable concept to property owners. The coworking space leases a unit from the building owner in exchange for a fixed rental rate, a tenant improvement budget, and a security deposit. This provides a predictable cash flow to the building owner as long as the coworking space remains in businesses. However, predictable often means lower returns and more entrepreneurial property owners have options that have the potential for higher returns. 

Leading coworking chains like WeWork make their money through short-term contracts with office users, meaning its income can go up and down with the whims of the market. But the rent it pays landlords is fixed. This so-called asset-liability mismatch at the root of the coworking industry is well known, and after the COVID-19 pandemic and WeWork‘s failed IPO, many investors and coworking space operators are looking past the lease and towards different models of shared risk and reward. 

Starting Your Own Coworking Business

For dedicated entrepreneurs looking to maximize the potential profit of their property, or for investors looking to establish a brand across multiple cities in their portfolio, building and operating a coworking brand may be the best step. 

Property owners that build their own coworking brand from scratch tend to work best when they can leverage their assets so the entire portfolio benefits. Apartments with commercial space attached can use coworking as an amenity to the tenants and fill empty commercial space in the portfolio. An investor might convert a vacant retail space in the suburbs to coworking so the entire block is seen as upscale and desirable to other CRE tenants. 

Of course, out of all the business models, the DIY route carries the highest level of risk and time-to market. Expect two years to reach profitability and leave margin (time and budget) for initial errors and cost overruns. Where possible, reach out to experienced consultants and operators as advisors.

Propques, a marketplace to create & add coworking space business.

Armed with big smiles, over 6 years of national experience, operational expertise and in-depth industry knowledge our goal was and still is today to help as many individuals as possible establish their own footprint in the flexible workspace industry.

We waited a long time to say this…But there has never been a more exciting time in this industry and we want to be right there driving strategies that work, formulas that produce fantastic ROI’s and provide free operational resources for existing providers and their teams across India – no matter where they might be in their flexible workspace journey.

What we can do

What is Possible : Uncover the possibilities and viability of your vision, floorplan, member models within a single location or full portfolio.

How to Maximize ROI : Develop a profitable facility and service strategy with our proven formulas.

We Manage (Sales , Marketing , Operation ) it for you : Utilize our decades of industry know-how to sequence the processes from day one through to launch and beyond.

We Train and Support your Team : We are serious about your success and can train and support your team from start up, launch and ongoing support.

But the best part of all… is to work right alongside each and every client, show them what’s possible and arm them with tried, tested operational tools, resources and the ability to build a really incredible, rewarding and financially successful workspace business.

Got a Question?

We are here to assist. Simply fill the form to help us understand your business, vision, and goals, so we can provide our exceptional services and suggestions to you.

“TURN YOUR VISION INTO A REALITY”

Please submit your inquiry via the form and you’ll hear back from us shortly.

+91-7392037856 | buzz@propques.com

The post How to add/start Coworking Space at your owned property appeared first on Propques.

item.title: The Best Way To Start A Coworking Business
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents There are many things to consider when starting a new business. The type of business you start, the location you choose, how you will run it, and other factors make up a considerable list of considerations that could impact your success greatly. In this article I’ll be taking a look at the …

The Best Way To Start A Coworking Business Read More »

The post The Best Way To Start A Coworking Business appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

There are many things to consider when starting a new business. The type of business you start, the location you choose, how you will run it, and other factors make up a considerable list of considerations that could impact your success greatly. In this article I’ll be taking a look at the best way to start a coworking space for those who may not know about these spaces.

Why Should I Start A Coworking Business?

If you’re considering starting a coworking business, there are plenty of reasons why it’s a great idea. For starters, coworking spaces are in high demand, especially in urban areas. This means that there’s a good chance you’ll be able to fill your space and make a profit. Additionally, starting a coworking business is relatively low-risk and low-cost, especially compared to other types of businesses.

Of course, the biggest reason to start a coworking business is that you’ll be able to help people achieve their professional goals. By providing a supportive and collaborative environment, you can give your members the tools they need to succeed. If you’re passionate about making a difference in the lives of others, then starting a coworking business is definitely the right choice for you.

What Kind of Space Do I Need For My Coworking Space?

When it comes to starting your own coworking space, one of the most important factors to consider is the type of space you’ll need. Do you have a large office that can be divided into smaller, private workspace areas? Or are you looking for a more open concept space where members can mingle and collaborate?

Think about the type of business you want to run and the types of members you want to attract. If you’re hoping to attract freelancers or remote workers, then a more relaxed and open concept space might be best. However, if you’re looking to attract startups or small businesses, then a more traditional office space with private workspaces might be a better option.

Once you’ve decided on the type of space you need, it’s time to start thinking about location. Where is your ideal coworking space going to be located? Do you want to be in the heart of the city, or do you prefer a more suburban location? Consider foot traffic and public transportation when choosing your location – you want it to be convenient for members to get to and from your space.

Finally, make sure you have a clear budget in mind before signing any lease agreements. coworking spaces can be expensive, so it…

How Do I Find People To Join My Co-Working Space?

As the co-working industry continues to grow, so does the demand for new and innovative spaces. If you’re thinking about starting your own co-working business, you’re probably wondering how to find people to join your space.

There are a few ways to go about this. First, you can reach out to your personal network and see if anyone is interested in joining your co-working space. This is a great way to get started because it gives you a group of people who are already familiar with you and your work style.

Another option is to use online tools and resources to reach out to potential members. There are a number of websites and online communities dedicated to connecting people who are looking for co-working spaces. By posting information about your space on these sites, you can attract a wider range of members.

Finally, you can also promote your space through local events and meetups. This is a great way to get exposure for your business and meet potential members in person. Attend local events that relate to your target market and let people know about your space. You can also host your own events at your co-working space to help promote it and attract new members.

What Are The Benefits Of Starting A Coworking Space?

The coworking business model has a number of benefits for both the entrepreneurs who start the space and the workers who use it. For the entrepreneur, a coworking space can be a relatively low-cost way to start a business. The overhead costs are lower than those of a traditional office, and there is no need to invest in furniture or equipment.

There is also less risk involved in starting a coworking space than other types of businesses. The coworking business model is flexible, and if one location does not work out, it is easy to move to another. Additionally, coworking spaces often generate a lot of word-of-mouth marketing, which can help to attract new members.

For workers, coworking spaces offer an alternative to working from home or from a traditional office. Coworking spaces provide a supportive community for freelancers and entrepreneurs, and they offer amenities that are not always available at home or in a traditional office, such as high-speed internet and coffee. Additionally, coworking spaces can help to increase productivity by providing a quiet place to work outside of the distractions of home life.

What Does It Cost To Start A Coworking Business?

When it comes to starting a coworking business, the biggest question on most people’s minds is usually “How much does it cost?”

The answer to that question can vary greatly depending on the size and scope of your coworking operation. However, there are some general costs that are associated with starting any business, including a coworking business. Some of the initial costs you can expect to incur when starting a coworking business include:

-Rent or mortgage payments for your coworking space

-Utility bills for your coworking space

-Furniture and office equipment for your coworking space

-Insurance for your coworking space

-Marketing and advertising expenses

Of course, these are just some of the general costs associated with starting a coworking business. Your actual start-up costs will depend on many factors, including the location of your coworking space, the type of amenities you plan to offer, and the size of your operation.

How Can You Optimize Profitability With A Coworking Business?

There are three key ways to optimize profitability for a coworking business:

1. Increase membership revenue.

The best way to optimize profitability is to increase membership revenue. This can be done by increasing monthly membership fees, adding new membership tiers, or offering additional services that members can pay for.

2. Decrease expenses.

Optimizing profitability also involves reducing expenses where possible. This could mean negotiating better rates with suppliers, automating processes to reduce labor costs, or finding ways to cut down on other operating expenses.

3. Increase non-membership revenue streams.

In addition to membership revenue, coworking businesses can also generate income from other sources, such as renting out meeting space, selling coffee and snacks, or offering coworking memberships to corporate clients. By diversifying their income sources, coworking businesses can further reduce their dependence on any one stream of revenue and further optimize their profitability.

Building a Community with a CoWorking Space

In the business world, it’s all about who you know. And in today’s digital age, making those connections is easier than ever before. That’s why coworking spaces have become increasingly popular in recent years, as they provide a unique opportunity for professionals to network and collaborate with one another.

If you’re thinking of starting your own coworking business, there are a few things you should keep in mind. First and foremost, it’s important to create a space that is both comfortable and inviting. This means having plenty of seating, plenty of natural light, and a variety of different areas to accommodate different types of work.

Second, you’ll need to build a community around your coworking space. This can be done by hosting regular events and providing opportunities for members to interact with one another. Encouraging members to get to know one another on a personal level will help create a more cohesive community and make your coworking space more appealing to potential members.

Finally, remember that running a successful coworking business takes time and effort. It’s not something that can be done overnight. So be patient, stay focused, and most importantly, have fun!

Finally, you’ll need to build a strong team to help you launch and manage your coworking business. Choose Propques Expert Team who are passionate about the coworking model and who have the skills and experience to help you succeed. With the right team in place, you can confidently launch your business and start attracting members.

The post The Best Way To Start A Coworking Business appeared first on Propques.

item.title: How To Be Expand/Start Your Coworking Space at New Location with Right Decision
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
We know there’s a lot of uncertainty and questions when you’re first deciding if flex office space is the right move for your property or a property you’re interested in. We’re here to provide you with the research and analytics to answer those questions. The first step is to run a Demand Analysis Report based …

How To Be Expand/Start Your Coworking Space at New Location with Right Decision Read More »

The post How To Be Expand/Start Your Coworking Space at New Location with Right Decision appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
We know there’s a lot of uncertainty and questions when you’re first deciding if flex office space is the right move for your property or a property you’re interested in. We’re here to provide you with the research and analytics to answer those questions. The first step is to run a Demand Analysis Report based on your property’s demographics to green light your pursuit of flex office space.

What is a Demand Analysis? 

Propques priority is to provide our clients with critical knowledge of consumer behavior before next steps are made past the back of the napkin math. The first step is knowing whether or not the location of your future coworking space is sustainable for the market. Our Demand Analysis research is conducted with over seven years of experience in the coworking industry. We determine whether you can successfully enter the market and obtain expected profit based on the demographics of your location, sustainable square footage of your space, and a customer demand forecast in that area. The Demand Analysis is a crucial step in your coworking business model and provides essential insights for the decision making process. 

What You’ll Learn from the Demand Analysis:

  • How much square feet of flex space can be supported in the area
  • The business model and build out that work best for the area
  • The type of building that can be used for for the coworking operation

This is a sample report for a space in Jaipur showing that 17,000 SF of flex office space is suitable for the market in this area based on the local demographics and provides suggested coworking models of High-end to Flexible Office suits.

What does Propques do?

A successful flex office space depends on the ability to identify and satisfy its customers needs. Propques research will identify the market, assess the business cycle, make sure your coworking style meets a particular niche market in the area, and determine your competitive advantages. These will be determined through a careful assessment with real numbers and local market research that you can trust. 

To begin your process, set up a call with a Propques Expert to discuss your need for a Demand Analysis Report. We will tell it to you straight because we want to insure confidence in your process.

The post How To Be Expand/Start Your Coworking Space at New Location with Right Decision appeared first on Propques.
